stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: GCHQ Themed Phishing Email Delivers Frutas RAT
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 03 December 2014 a U.S. government department observed phishing emails using the address secretariat.lukash@gmail.com and carrying a password protected RAR archive. The attachment contained a copy of the FRUTAS RAT which, if installed successfully, attempts to contact a C2 server on the domain parliament.ns01.info.
For additional information on related phishing activity please reference:IB-14-10161, IB-14-10176, IB-13-10774, and AR-13-10014

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
----- BEGIN EMAIL INFORMATION -----
From: Lukash Svetlana <secretariat.lukash@gmail.com>; To: european.action.group@gmail.com; Bcc: [REDACTED] Date: Wed Dec 03 00:46:58 GMT 2014 Subject: GCHQ GERONTIC NIGELLA Bases Eyed Attachment: GCHQ tap codenamed NIGELLA.rar
I offer my thoughts further to the recent suggestions of the huge data centre at Skewjack Farm as the GCHQ "tap" codenamed NIGELLA, part of the Cable and Wireless GERONTIC collusion. password: gchqpass123
----- END EMAIL INFORMATION -----
This is a password-protected archive file containing the malicious executable file webservice.jar.

The attachment GCHQ tap codenamed NIGELLA.rar is password protected with the password gchqpass123 provided in the body of the email. The RAR contains the executable webservice.jar. The executable appears to be the Frutas RAT, a publicly available java based RAT. This binary is an executable java file.
When executed, it creates a copy of itself into "C:\Documents and Settings\User\Application Data\webservice.jar" and sets up persistence by altering Internet Explorer's registry key HKU\S-1-5-21-1454471165-1644491937-839522115-1003\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\Iexplorer: ""C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javaw.exe" -jar "C:\Documents and Settings\User\Application Data\webservice.jar
The malware attempts to resolve the domain "parliament.ns01.info", and if successful, attempts to send TCP "psh acks" over port 8192 containing the string: ..http.
